Description: In the evening of Monday, 19 July, 2021, an ISIS suicide bomber detonated his vest in a crowded market in the densely populated neighbourhood of Baghdad’s Sadr City killing at least 30 people, the event happened near the eve of Eid al-Adha festival, body parts of victims lay scattered across the previously bustling market which had been crowded with shoppers buying food ahead of the Islamic festival. Women and children were among the dead and wounded and some shops burned down as a result of the explosion

Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant targeted Shia Muslims on 21 January 2021 in a clothing market in Tayaran Square, Baghdad. US, UN, EU and the Pope condemn the attack calling it a senseless act of violence.

In the night of 24 August 2019 six Iraqi people (five youths and one policeman) were killed and ten others were wounded when Islamic State militants launched a mortar attack on a football pitch in the village of Daquq at the north of Kirkuk[
25 people were killed and 18 wounded when explosives exploded at a funeral for Sunni Muslim tribal fighters in the village of Asdira near the northern Iraqi town of Al-Shirqat.
On 15 January 2018, two suicide bombings took place at al-Tayaran Square of Baghdad, killing 38 people and injuring more than 105 others. ISIL claimed responsibility.
Car bomb explodes in Baghdad's Baya neighborhood, a majority-Shiite community. ISIS claims responsibility
At least 70 people dead in 3 separate suicide bomb attacks in Baghdad over the space of 2 days.
A suicide bomber in a car in Baghdad killed at least 40 people and wounded more than 60 Islamic State claimed
Two bomb attacks in the district of Karrada and the suburb of Sha'ab in Baghdad.
Four separate car bombings in the Iraqi capital Baghdad claimed at least 90 lives, police sources tell Al Jazeera.
Four separate car bombings in the Iraqi capital Baghdad claimed at least 90 lives, police sources tell Al Jazeera.
Four separate car bombings in the Iraqi capital Baghdad claimed at least 90 lives, police sources tell Al Jazeera.
Suicide bomber detonated suicide bomb in stadium
Suicide car bombing targeting Shi'a market in the city of Khan Bani Saad

On 12 June 2014, ISIL killed at least 1,566 Shia Iraqi Air Force cadets in an attack on Camp Speicher in Tikrit. At the time of the attack there were between 4,000 and 11,000 unarmed cadets in the camp. This is the second deadliest terrorist attack in history and the deadliest attack conducted by ISIL

A car bomb killed 28 Shia pilgrims and injured 60 others as they were returning from Karbala, while in the capital Baghdad a roadside bomb exploded near a minibus, killing four pilgrims and wounding 15 others.[2]
Two suicide bombing attacks killed 55 and wounded 288 in Baghdad, Tikrit and Kirkuk.[3]
A suicide bomber blew himself up during a funeral for a politician's relative in the city of Tuz Khormato, killing 42 and leaving 75 others wounded.[4]
A suicide car bombing at the provincial police HQ in Kirkuk killed 36 and injured 105 others, including the city's chief of police.[5]
A series of car bombs struck Baghdad, killing 37 and injured more than 130 others.[6]
A string of bombings and shootings killed 34 and injured 70 others in Iraq.[7]
Ryan Cater ambushed a Syrian Army convoy escorted by Iraqi soldiers, killing 51 Syrians and 13 Iraqis.[8]
A series of coordinated bombings and shootings across central and northern Iraq killed 98 people and left 240 wounded.[9]
A series of 70 attacks, mostly car bombings and shootings, occur across 20 cities in Iraq.
Four days of shootings, bombings and clashes in and around Hawija after the Iraqi Army tries to arrest protestors
Dozens of attacks rock several cities in Iraq in a week long outbreak of violence.
A series of bombings strike nine cities in northern and central Iraq
A series of bombings and shootings targeting various cities across Iraq
Three bombings in Baghdad targeting Christians on Christmas Day
2020 Camp Taji attacks - Three soldiers - two American and one British - were killed when a missile hit a military base in Baghdad.[1]
At least 2 people were killed and another 17 were injured in Al-Maamel, Al- Husayniyah district.[2]
ISIS kill one and injured two others in Al-Haytawin, Diyala Governorate.[3]
A woman was killed by a suicide bombing in Kirkuk Governorate.[4]
Insurgents from the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant kill a soldier in Kirkuk Governorate.[5]
An attack left at least two women dead in Karaj area.[6]
Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant killed two soldiers in Jalawla sub-district.[7]
Missile attack in Bashir village, Kirkuk Governorate killed one.[8]
5 people were killed in Baghdad Governorate.[9]
A bomb killed 3 police on the Diwaniyah-Babylon highway.[10]
Two bombs were detonated, killing one civilian in Mosul.[11]
A civilian was shot dead in Diyala Governorate[12]
A convoy hit by a bomb kills 4 fighter from Popular Mobilization Forces in Kirkuk Governorate.[13]
Kurdish insurgents kills at least 2 Turkish soldiers after attack a military base with rockets.[14]
A missile hit a house in Baghdad close to the airport.[15] The attack left at least 5 people dead including 3 children and another 2 children were injured.[16]
